definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: I know him only by sight.
So Japan had invited Ggong to have his fans meeting there.
sentences.chinese: 所以日方邀请孔刘来日本举行影迷见面会。

sentences.english: And for the presentation, if it's not on Friday, it will be on Monday at the latest.
sentences.chinese: 至于见面会，如果不在周五，那么最迟也在下周一。

sentences.english: Talks and laughs merrily the conference for played the families to make the good impression.
sentences.chinese: 谈笑风生的见面会给玩家们留下了良好的印象。

sentences.english: The President took a short meet-and-greet walk to the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 总统到酒店出席了一个简短见面会。

sentences.english: Then I turned the meeting over to Gloria.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我让格洛里亚在见面会上讲话。

definition: to have an informal discussion/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]
road show or promotional tour (for a product etc)
to talk with sb (face to face)/discussion/talk/chat
to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
